item.title: Pickup Command
item.dc:creator: @Hackerz Hackerz
item.description:
@Hackerz wrote:

Thanks i compared your code to mine and found out that the only thing diff is this

int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));
see the number on your post is 13 i changed the 12 to a 13 and now i can add items up to 50000 Thanks for the post

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Command
item.dc:creator: @pwnedurmom pwnedurmom
item.description:
@pwnedurmom wrote:

dude moparscape doesn’t support items over 10k, gl with that.
well it supports some, silabsoft is the way to go if you want to add items 10k +
client.silabsoft.org <----- log in with that and then alter your pickup command in client like this

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 16, 2008, 12:53:40 AM[/size][hr][code] if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! ");
        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Command

item.description:
@pwnedurmom wrote:

Hackerz:

no i can pickup items under 10000 but i cant pickup items above 10000

because you didn’t fucking add a 0 infront !!! omfg!!! if the item is 995 add 2 fucking 0’s infront of it like this
::pickup 00995 2147000000 damnnnnn

orrrr are you using silabsoft client or moparscape?
